intro: Celsia armeniaca, commonly known as Armenian celsia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. It is often found in rocky or woodland habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
